reason.html: There's an easy to merge pull request with the same content: #!/osrf/cloudsim/pull-request/48/command-to-attach-a-cloudsim-to-a-team-and

description.raw:
**Note: This pull request should be merged after [this one](#!/osrf/cloudsim/pull-request/39/send_taskspy-a-command-line-tool-for/diff). The only real difference is the file bin/attach_cloudsims.py** 

This tool updates the VRC Portal's database. For each team present in the teams.yaml file:

  1. The IP of its associated CloudSim is retrieved. 
  2. A new line containing teamID and CloudSim IP is appended into a temporary text file.
  3. The text file is upload into the VRC Portal.
  4. The VRC Portal database is updated using the text file.

**How can I test the code using Amazon?**

  1. Go to the vrcportal-test and log in as an admin. Check the Practice/Final tab of some Team's page and verify that the CloudSim URL is not available (there is a new box for this purpose). 
  2. Launch a CloudSim on your local machine.
  3. Connect to your local CloudSim and launch two new CloudSim constellations (CS-01, CS-02)
  4. Modify teams.yaml (you can find test files inside the yaml/ directory), by adding the new constellation names to two of the teams.
  5. Run the tool.
    Ex) ./bin/attach_cloudsim.py yaml/teams.yaml -p vrcportal-test.osrfoundation.org
  6. Go to the vrcportal-test and log in as an admin
  7. Go to the Team's page of the teams you modified and check the Practice/Final tabs. The URL of each CloudSim should be available.
  8. Follow the link and verify that a CloudSim is there.
